greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, obtained by omitting all the 1's from the triangle in A307641 (except for the first row).
comment: Has same shape as the triangle in A027746. The first difference occurs at row 12.
link: Michel Marcus, Rows n=1..3000 of triangle, flattened (first 131 rows from I. V. Serov)
formula: For i > 1, T(i, A001222(i)) = A088387(i). This is the last term of the i-th row.
program: row(n) = if (n==1, [1], my(d=divisors(n)); select(x->x!=1, vector(#d, k, f(d[k]))));
tabl(nn) = for (n=1, nn, print(row(n))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 27 2019
results.author: _I. V. Serov_, Apr 26 2019
